comments.body: @lavalamp, I'm not sure about the file name (unversioned_test.go). I'm happy to modify the file name if you have other idea.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@/*
Copyright 2015 The Kubernetes Authors All rights reserved.

comments.body: tiny nit: I think if you say %s, you can pass a []byte and it will convert automatically.

On the package arrangement.

pkg/conversion was sort of intended to be a layer independent from the rest of the code, such that we could toss it in its own repository. Importing the api packages like this makes that impossible.

Can you add a TODO here, saying that it's pretty hacky to import api like this, and that ideally we should recreate the necessary package structure in e.g. `pkg/conversion/test/...`.

Alternatively, you could recreate the necessary package structure in e.g. `pkg/conversion/test/...` but that's a lot of work and we can probably defer it.
I don't follow. Could you explain more on "recreate the necessary package structure"? Thanks.

I mean like make

```
pkg/conversion/internal/test/apis/v1/types.go
pkg/conversion/internal/test/apis/unversioned/types.go
```

And then add just enough code to those packages to use them in the tests, instead of using the real pkg/api & pkg/apis/unversioned packages.

But just add a TODO-- we've got too much to do to do this right now. :)
I see. I'll just a TODO for now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +25,29 @@	// pkg/conversion/test/... instead of importing pkg/api here.
	"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/api"
	"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/api/testapi"
	"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/api/unversioned"
	"k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/runtime"
